task.title: Removing the Differential Gears
task.shortdesc: This task describes how to remove the differential gears from the inner ends of the rear axle shafts where they are secured by split retaining rings.

context.p: The differential gears are keyed to the inner ends of the rear axle shafts and secured by split retaining rings that fit into grooves in the shafts. These gears interact with the differential pinions during turns to allow independent axle shaft rotation, while moving as one unit during straight-line driving.

step.cmd: Push the differential gears inward on the shaft
step.info: Force the gears away from their secured end position on the shaft
Using a screwdriver or chisel, carefully drive out both halves of the retaining ring from the shaft grooves
Force the gears off the ends of the axle shafts

result.p: The differential gears will be separated from the axle shafts.
